title: Liz Ancel
text:
Speech-Language Pathologist
Doctoral student in Speech-Language-Hearing Sciences at the University of Minnesota
Word Enthusiast

title: About
text: My name is Liz Ancel and I am a fourth-year doctoral student in the Speech-Language-Hearing Sciences at the University of Minnesota.

title: About
text:
Education
2016: B.S. in Speech, Language, and Hearing Sciences at Purdue University.
2018: M.S. in Speech-Language Pathology at Purdue University
2026: Ph.D. in Speech-Language-Hearing Sciences at University of Minnesota. (Projected)

title: About
text:
References
Hank | Chief Barking Scientist | Three Bark Manor
Sadie | Naptime Engineer | Three Bark Manor

title: CV
About
text:
Research Labs
Studies in the Applied Sociolinguistics of Speech and Language with Benjamin Munson

Child Language Intervention Lab with Liza Finestack

(Previously) Auditory Cognitive Neurosciences Laboratory with Natalya Kaganovich

title: About
text:
Publications
Ancel, E., Munson, B., & Finestack, L. H., (2023, November 16-18) Acoustic Variability of Interventionists’ Productions During Sentence Imitation. [Poster presentation] American Speech-Language-Hearing Association Convention, Boston, MA, United States.
Ancel, E., Lee, H., Kornelis, M., Kuchler, K., Matthys, O., & Finestack, L. H., (2023, November 16-18) Five Principles to Consider When Targeting Grammatical Forms. [Oral presentation] American Speech-Language-Hearing Association Convention, Boston, MA, United States.
Kuchler, K., Kornelis, M., Ancel, E., Lee, H., & Finestack, L. H., (2023, November 16-18) Implementation Feasibility of an Explicit-based Intervention Targeting Grammatical Verb Forms for Children with DLD. [Poster presentation] American Speech-Language-Hearing Association Convention, Boston, MA, United States.
Ancel, E., Smith, M.L., Rao, V.N.V., & Munson, B. (2023). Relating Acoustic Measures to Listener Ratings of Children’s Productions of Word-Initial /ɹ/ and /w/. Journal of Speech, Language, and Hearing Research, 1-15. https://doi.org/10.1044/2023_JSLHR-22-00713
Finestack, L. H., Ancel, E., Lee, H., Kuchler, K., & Kornelis, M. (2023). Five Additional Evidence-Based Principles to Facilitate Grammar Development for Children with Developmental Language Disorder. American Journal of Speech-Language Pathology, 1-12. https://10.1044/2023_AJSLP-23-00049
Finestack, L. H., Linert, J., Ancel, E., Kuchler, K., & Matthys, O. (2023). Verbs matter: A tutorial for determining verb difficulty. American Journal of Speech-Language Pathology, 1-18. https://doi.org/10.1044/2023_AJSLP-22-00333
Ancel, E., Munson, B., & Finestack, L. H. (2023, May 8-12). Acoustic Variability of Examiners’ Productions During Language Assessment. [Poster presentation]. 185th Meeting of the Acoustical Society of America, Chicago, IL, United States.
Ancel, E. (2023, May 8-12). Active Cultural Responsivity to Terminology in Speech and Hearing Science. [Oral presentation]. 185th Meeting of the Acoustical Society of America, Chicago, IL, United States.
Lee, H., Kornelis, M., Ancel, E., Matthys, O., & Finestack, L. H. (2023, April 22) Verbs matter! Intervention approaches to consider when targeting grammatical forms. [Oral presentation] Minnesota Speech-Language-Hearing Association Convention, Virtual.
Ancel, E (2023, March 23) Linguistic Diversity. [Guest Lecture] EPSY 3132: Psychology of Multiculturalism in Education, Univeristy of Minnesota.
Munson, B. & Ancel, E. (2022, November 17-19) How Chidlren Learn Gendered Speech, and Why It Matters for Speech-Language Pathology. [Oral presentation] American Speech-Language-Hearing Association Convention, New Orleans, LA, United States.
Ancel, E., Kuchler, K., Linert, J., Matthys, O., & Finestack, L. H. (2022, November 17-19) Verbs matter! Intervention approaches to consider when targeting grammatical forms. [Poster presentation] American Speech-Language-Hearing Association Convention, New Orleans, LA, United States.

Kaganovich, N., & Ancel, E. (2019). Different neural processes underlie visual speech perception in school-age children and adults: An event-related potentials study. Journal of Experimental Child Psychology, 184, 98-122. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jecp.2019.03.009
Kaganovich, N., & Ancel, E. (2018, February). Audiovisual Word-Matching in School-Age Children: An ERP Study [Poster presentation]. Ringel Evidence-Based Practice Symposium, West Lafayette, IN, United States.
Kaganovich, N., & Ancel, E. (2017, October). Audiovisual Word-Matching in School-Age Children: An ERP Study [Poster presentation]. Crossroads Conference on Communicative Disorders, West Lafayette, IN, United States.
